Reviews.Title: “A memorable holiday”
Reviews.Author: FRANCESMELTONMOWBRAY
Reviews.Content: y friend and I really enjoyed our stay at The Holiday Inn Rohrdamm. Our room was very clean, spacious and very adequate for all our needs. The staff were courteous at all times. The breakfast was excellent and we had a good meal in the evening on one occasion during our visit. We loved the swimming pool and furthermore fervently wished we could have prolonged our stay. Everything was spot on and we would definitely chose to stay again should our travels take us in this direction. Also we will recommend this friendly hotel to friends and relations. Well done and good luck to you all in the future. Frances Waite and Mike Court of Melton Mowbray

Reviews.Title: “Clean but pretty awful..”
Reviews.Author: Trolly_dollyxx
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very plain with horrible furniture and the beds are extremely uncomfortable. You have to pay for tea and coffee, the complimentary water I received had already been open and a small amount consumed. Room service is also very expensive (if you can actually get through to them on the phone.. it took me nearly 20mins) There is some sort of dodgy heating red light on the ceiling of the bathroom, very 70s!! There is no facility to have an in room iron.. instead you have to lug your clothing to an "ironing room".... The bar staff downstairs are very friendly but it lacks atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: woodysgirl82
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the staff was friendly. Breakfast was good and filled us up for the day. The bar was very inviting and offered so many different drinks, this was fabulous after a long day of touring Berlin. A little far from the city centre, but the metro service is right around the corner. Overall, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melissa N
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel regularly as I am cabin crew and we often stay here. The room is quite nice and the beds are adequatly comfortable, however I have since received some bites which I think may be due to bed mites. Also be aware that you will be charged for wi-fi use in your room and for the tea/coffee/drinks/snacks. I will make sure to ask at reception next time if there is a room with free wi-fi access as I have been told there is. I also did not find the iron in the ironing room particulary clean. Overall I would say my experience at the hotel was average.

Reviews.Title: “In line with the Chain..........”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav S
Reviews.Content: I Visited Holiday Inn Berlin City-West in the month of March 2011, I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Siemens. For a business trip this place is quite comfortable, rooms were quite big and clean at the same time totally in line with the rest of the hotels of this chain... Breakfast they served was very good. This place is just 5 mins away for U-bahn station so ur connectivity to the city centre is no issue. Friendly staff is an added bonus......... Thumbs up keep up the good work........

Reviews.Title: “usual”
Reviews.Author: IanElliott
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn - what needs to be said? Very boring area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality.”
Reviews.Author: shawnjmartin
Reviews.Content: Great modern sized room, LCD TV, business centre with free internet terminals and print services. Helpful staff, lovely restaurant, bar and tourism stands. The walk to the nearest underground station was 5 minutes and you were in city centre within 25 minutes. There are a few handy cafes and supermarkets about the place if need be. The hotel could have provided free Wi-Fi but wasnt a huge blow. There is a relaxation centre and swimming pools also available for use. The bathroom in our room was also very clean and spacious. Plenty of room to move!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alexandr K
Reviews.Content: Nice old tree at the entrance. Nice green lights. The bar on the ground floor is beatiful. The pizza was really delicious. Splendid hotel, wonderful rooms, good service. U-bahn is 5 minutes walking. The awesome place for the city-breaks. I like it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel just ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Torino74
Reviews.Content: The room is failry nice, the restaurant has good food. Wireless expensive as every hotel. The good thing is that it is only 10 minutes from the airport Taegel. The room are quite. The TV does not have international channels. The taxi from the hotel might complainto to take you there if you do not pay by cash

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: TRoschelleT
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at this hotel in Berlin and I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is modern, provides an open concept, close to the airport, quiet and provides good customer service. Since I am a platinum priority club member, I was upgraded to a suite. The suite is very spacious, modern and cozy. The food from room service was good and delivered promptly. I will definitely stay here again when I am in Berlin on business.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, but the Extra Expenses!”
Reviews.Author: Cargotraveler
Reviews.Content: This is really the first time I have ever stayed in a hotel where I felt that the primary goal of the hotel was for the staff to milk me for extra money! The hotel is clean and located in a very quiet and convenient location. The subway is only about a 300 meter walk from the entrance to the hotel. The rooms are clean, and are comfortable. The only real problem with the hotel is that EVERYTHING has an extra charge to it. Would you like a cup of coffee while checking in at the desk? 3,50 Euro. Want a cup of coffee or tea in your room? 1,50 Euro. Want to take the shuttle to the airport? Pay the Euros! The internet fees bordered on the ridiculous we charge ranging in the 10,00 Euro per hour range. As a business traveler, I would have much rather paid for my stay and not had to calculate the added expenses in my travel report, I had breakfast at the hotel, but after paying 19,00 Euro ($27.00 US), I decided that I would not do so again. It just wasn't worth the price. The food was good, but how much better can eggs and bacon be here than anywhere else? One nice thing about the staff- they wear a name tag with a small flag to identify the languages that they speak. You will have no problems communicating if you only speak English or French.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was nice, the service was slow”
Reviews.Author: MyBTJ
Reviews.Content: Maybe they weren't having a "good day" at the hotel but connecting with the airport shuttle became a real hour long hassle, even though I coordinated this ahead of time. So my advice is as follows: If you are using the airport shuttle, get an exact description from the driver ahead of time when where he will be meeting you. It took me 3 International roaming calls ($20 USD) to finally have the driver tell me that he is not allowed access to the terminal that I landed at and I needed to walk to the next terminal. Another issue is that the computers were not working when I got there, not what you want after an overnight Int'l flight. They couldn't give me a room key, or pull up my file. Check in took 20 minutes. When I checked out it took them 15 minutes to process my Priority Club card.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, dated and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Amanda54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on a business trip. The hotel facilities and rooms are very dated. Everything costs extra (even the tea bags and instant coffee in the rooms are €1.50) and the internet charges were very high. The fitness facilities were dire (in 2 dark sweaty rooms adjacent to the pool and sauna in the basement) and consisted of 3 or 4 cardio machines and not much else; I opted to go running outdoors instead! The room was noisy from very early morning as you could hear people taking showers and their TV's. The breakfast buffet was poor; very little fresh fruit, fruit juice in big dispensing machines - it felt more like a canteen. Lots of TV channels but only news options in English. Menu choices in the bar & restaurant were limited and uninspiring and the bar is a huge characterless space next to reception with awful music and soccer on TV. The only positive were the helpful and polite staff; with the notable exception of the cleaner who entered my room without knocking at 8am! This hotel will struggle once Tegel Airport closes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...too many charges”
Reviews.Author: classicalmusician
Reviews.Content: The comfort and service at this hotel near the airport and U-Bahn station was excellent. There was no airport noise. We were able to buy tickets for the U-Bahn and sightseeing bus right at the hotel service desk. In this day and age the extra charge for internet access is a shame. The high price for breakfast (19 euros) was excessive. But this was the first time that we had ever been charged (1.50 euro) for the in-room coffee. While it didn't cost much, it seemed petty for a high class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: K98
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on TA reviews, the reasonable tariff and the Holiday Inn tag. I wanted a clean, modern and no fuss-but-adequate place, and the hotel fit my bill. Positives: 1. Very clean, looked new. Room was quite comfortable. Pillows were nice. 2. Bathroom was nice, shiny, well-maintained fittings, all glass and steel. 3. Front office staff was very helpful and friendly, guiding me on Berlin's tourist and shopping attractions and the transportation system. 4. The hotel is located in a quiet leafy suburb in Berlin, I found it very restful and calming. 5. Located about 15 minutes from the airport, they have a free shuttle drop which is very convenient. 6. A short walk to the S Bahn station, you can get into downtown in 10 minutes 7. Good value for money The flip side: 1. Primarily a business hotel, large clientele from Siemens. 2. Location is not a happening place, no restaurants, shops nearby. 3. Non-existent concierge service, though the front office staff were very helpful. 4. The S bahn station is a walk, not really next door 5. Food, specially breakfast, is very expensive 6. Internet access is charged Overall, a clean, adequate stay at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Cold, Indifferent”
Reviews.Author: pradipd25
Reviews.Content: This is not so much an airport hotel as a Siemens hotel. It is bang next to the huge Siemens complex, and seems to cater primarily to their employees and visitors. This was eveident from the large groups of guests in the lobby and the restaurant who were the corporate types. More importantly, it was evident from the cold, indifferent staff in Reception and the restaurant. They all appeared to be in a rush, instead of exuding any warmth and care. It is also not an airport hotel perse, because it is still a 15 minute drive from the airport, and the hotel shuttle is not free. But it may well be the closest hotel to Tegel airport. As a Platinum member we were upgraded to a larger room, but no breakfast or internet. Breakfast was quoted as 19 Euros per person which is a ripoff even for Western Europe. We had a good breakfast at the airport for less than 10 Euros for 2. The water in the bath tub would not drain properly, and we were first told that this is normal. Then we were told that it is not posible to check all rooms and bathrooms for all problems. Then we were offered a different room with no guarantee that the drain would be any better. We declined, having already unpacked and staying just for the night. And this Holiday Inn joins my Hall of Shameful Hotels that still have the temerity to charge extra for internet. The ironic thing is that this was the 4th Holiday in we stayed in our current trip in Europe, and the only one that charged for internet. Anothe rindication that this hotel is geared mainly for Siemens, since they would not mind paying the exorbitant charges for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: WEISSBIER
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here before our flight out of TXL. We are Platinum members and got nicely upgraded to a two room suite. The hotel is located in a residential area, there is a small supermarket next door. It is conveniently located close to the subway, which we took to the city for our sightseeing excursions. Reduced fare tickets were sold by the front desk. The hotel was quiet, the bed was comfortable. There was no coffee machine in the room, the Internet was not free and the shuttle to the airport costs money and needs to be reserved in advance. We had a car and found parking space on the street, otherwise there is a parking fee by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 1 night whilst snowed in at Berlin - Nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: yuen_clara
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when our flight to London got cancelled. The hotel was €69/night for a double room with no breakfast (for that you need to pay €18 per person). The room was spacious, clean and quiet modern. We had a really good night sleep in that room (can't hear next door's shower, door, etc). The hotel also has a business centre with 2 computers which is handy, although the internet speed there is on the slow end. Shuttle service is also available although you have to pre-book and it will cost you €3 per person. Location wise, we see an S barn nearby but it's a bit out of nowhere. I think the hotel would be great for business trip but not if your purpose is to explore the city of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: PAULWOODS1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and were given a room which was not bad but frankly not sensational. There were no facilities for making tea or coffee and one had the impression that the whole place was being run by young people with little experience. I am a Platinum Member and that counted for practically nothing. I was supposed to be offered a free drink - but they forgot to put the voucher in. The room was a double room but with one set of towels which really annoys me. The ultimate is the coffee machine in reception requires a Euro - there is free water however. Big deal. The place is full of Air Berlin crews and whilst I found the staff pleasant and well mannered frankly I would not bother with this except for its location. I'd go back to Mitte in a heartbeat - they made me feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday Inn with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: paullegate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Berlin City-West for two nights in a Suite on room only basis. The hotel is in a residential area of Berlin and about 5 stops from Spandau on the U3 and the nearest U-Bahn station from the hotel is Rohrdamm and is a 5-10 minute walk. Check in was straightforward, we checked in fairly early in the morning so the room was not ready but the cases were stored for us until our room was ready, the reception staff were constantly busy but were polite and proactive on all occasions. The suite was of substantial size consisting of large bedroom with comfortable bed, sitting room / dining area, bathroom and separate toilet and a lot of storage space. There were two flat screen TV’s, minibar, trouser press but no tea and coffee facilities. Breakfast was served in the main restaurant and the food selection was extensive and of good quality but at EUR18 it needed to be, the staff were attentive and friendly. We had room service twice and the food was delivered in 15 minutes and was piping hot and tasty. The hotel is of good standard and is within easy reach of the city by public transport and would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff and perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnteBante
Reviews.Content: Stayed only a night at this hotel in Berlin. First I was a little reluctant that it was a bit off the downtown area. But it was actually just between Tegel Airport and Bahnhof Zoo (old WestBerlin downtown). The U-bahn was about 200 metres away with trains ever 5-10 minutes. It took only 10 minutes to reach Bahnhof Zoo. Comparing the downtown hotels with this made me plan to come back here. A very nice hotel and very nice staff. I ate at the restaurant (very good meal and observant service), got late checkout without hassle, the cleaner to wait a little extra when I was late even for the late checkout (no hassle - only smiles). Also the inside of the hotel was very nice - spa, pool, lobby restaurant etc. Could recommend very much, it is worth the 10-15 minutes extra of U-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be too put off by the location”
Reviews.Author: Kenny-Lyle
Reviews.Content: Booked with group of friends attending Berlin Bier Festival at beginning of the month. Pleasantly surprised by the overall standard. Rooms recently renovated and very comfortable. Check in/out very quick and efficient. Extremely large and welcoming bar area. Didn't have breakfast as way overpriced .Holiday Inn appear to do this in Germany for whatever reason. With fast food outlets in the stations and local area, this was not a problem. Transport to and from centre Berlin by U-Bahn line 6 with station 300 yds from hotel. All in all would stay again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all - great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: wanderer087
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days while on a business trip. The rooms are spacious by holiday inn standards, and equipped with the conveniences that one can expect from a holiday inn. The staff was very courteous and also helped coordinate with the airline in getting back my delayed luggage. The breakfast spread is wonderful! A large buffet of hot and cold items, again slightly better than the typical holiday inn spread. The hotel has a lively bar with decent food and a more upscale restaurant serving mainly Italian/European cuisine. There really arent too many options to eat outside the hotel, but if you walk on to Rohrdamm (~5-10 min walk) I have seen one Italian restaurant there. The hotel is very accessible, costs about 12 Euros by taxi from Tegel airport. It also has a bus-stop right outside its entrance and the U-bahn is about a 10 min walk. Overall I was happy with the place but I'd recommend it only if you have some work to do in that area. Its quite far from the main city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay after just arriving from US”
Reviews.Author: Marie60898
Reviews.Content: After an overnight to Europe, I've always made it a point to stay at a reasonably priced hotel near the airport. The Holiday Inn Berlin City West fit my requirements and more. It is close to the subway stop for rapid ingress into downtown Berlin, there is a grocery store (Aldi's) near-by (for those who need a coca-cola or late night snack fix) along with an international food court and a number of decent restaurants if you don't wish to venture too far after your nap but don't want to be confined to a hotel restaurant. The staff was very helpful including the maid staff who showed me how to unlock my door (push door don't turn nob). I had a nice light room that faced the street. It was very comfortable. Noise? Yes when I opened the window to enjoy the fresh spring air but it is not a major road so night noise was zip with the window open, starting back up around 6:30am (my waking time anyway). The walls are thin so just hope you don't have a bunch of rowdy teens next door. I did not. For me the place was quiet as a tomb. My only negative was that the wi-fi was not free. But at least they had wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “It won't kill you, but you won't be delighted.”
Reviews.Author: GoodGretta
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this property but a few cautions to mention: The restaurant dinner buffet is terrible and pricey (18 eur). Breakfast buffet is great, but not included in the rate for some reason. The hotel bar has a bar menu that looked much better, but i didn't realize that existed until i noticed a woman eating something much more appetizing beside me after i had begrudgingly eaten from the restaurant buffet. I was not offered the bar menu in the restaurant....i recommend you ask for it before you delve into the dinner buffet. Second, the showers have a sign to be mindful of the changes in water temperature. Understatement. My showers were borderline dangerous due to the extreme variations in temperature. Personally, i find that unacceptable. My toilet quietly ran the entire time i had my room. This shows me that either a)housekeepers do not report such things to maintenance hence they are not corrected until a guest actually complains about it or b) the hotel doesn't prioritize these types of requests. I can only imagine how much water my particular toilet wasted during my 3 day stay. Third, the bed was hard, sheets were of poor quality, mattress did not have a pad on it to shield me from the springs in the bed and you only get two small, over-soft pillows. Hotels have two main things to deliver: a bed and a shower. This hotel does NOT do either. Internet access costs were insultingly high...and the connection was pretty slow. I will avoid this hotel on my next travels to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Forget it or else they forget you”
Reviews.Author: freekicker
Reviews.Content: This is actually a very nice and modern hotel in Siemensstadt, an industrial suburb of Berlin.. A benefit is the nearby metro station Rohrdamm (20 min to downtown) and the location just a few miles for Tegel airport, which is served by a hotel-owned shuttle. Rooms are large, bright and colourful and the quality of food in the restaurant is above average.. I also liked the sauna & pool area, which I enjoyed almost alone one afternoon (large pool, 2 saunas, enough beds for relaxing, fitness tools and fitness bar. At my arrival in the morning I was asked to fill in the reception forms, but then the check in procedure was postponed to 2 pm. On returning I took my luggage out of the locker, was handed over my key – again no special check in or welcome procedure, although I expected to get some breakfast/dinner vouchers etc. “The restaurant know all” was the receptionist’s answer, when I asked for the coupons. In the room I read about the group’s individualized pillow offer and, intending to comfortably watching a soccer game, asked housekeeping around 6 pm by phone for pillow #5. It arrived after the end of the game, shortly after 8 pm. At least she was not disturbed in watching her game. In the breakfast rooms with a large selection of cold and warm food and top quality fruit juices, they advertised for fresh made pancakes. I ordered one portion with maple sirup, showed my seat …. And was completely forgotten. No, not completely. The same guy next morning remembered me (“You are the guest who ordered pancakes yesterday !?”) and this time it worked. True not the ideal delivery behaviour to the visitor of the Berlin Logistics Convention … On check-out the inevitable happened. They did not know anything about my vouchers, attempted to charge the dinner (included in my package price) to me and only gave up after consulting to more management levels, although I had the original reservation for with all details and benefits with me all the time. Let’s not forget the departure. The shuttle started with 2 people (a young lady and me) and a mass of luggage, but just 2 min before arriving at the airport the driver was told that he forgot 3 people at the hotel, obviously distracted by the beautiful lady at his side …… Forget them at HI or else they forget you !

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for the Money”
Reviews.Author: vandkl
Reviews.Content: I had low expectations for the hotel because of some of the reviews I had read, however, I found the hotel very decent. It was close the airport and one of the closer hotels to the Messe Sud (convention center). I was attending a conference there, so it was perfect. It was also a short walk to the subway station. All together, it was perfect for a business traveler. The room service left something to be desired, but the breakfast in the morning was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to its rating”
Reviews.Author: unspecified
Reviews.Content: I was rather disappointed by this hotel. Despite its 4-star rating and ambience - lots of glass everywhere - there were several flaws. The rooms had white curtains - a simple mistake that means waking with sunrise - very annoying. The rooms were not very comfortable. The staff were not very friendly, and seemed very stressed. And the breakfasts, although initially appearing to be well appointed, were actually quite limited. You can do a lot worse than this hotel, but you can also do a lot better. As regards location, you're fairly near the airport, but not near anythign else of use. About five minutes away from Rohrdamm U-Bahn station, which can get you into town in about 20-30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “plastic matresses”
Reviews.Author: minimars
Reviews.Content: A smart modern hotel with a great lobby, adequate rooms and a superb breakfast. It was so uncomfortable to find there were plastic matresses that we only stayed one night instead of three because of this and also because of a decidedly strange extra 20 euros on the price for the second guest in the double room while the breakfast for the second guest was free. Also didn't think 10 euros a night for the hotlel car park were justified and the area the hotel was in wasn't very pleasant when we went out to look for a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We drove into Berlin last August (2002), having beenunable to visit Dresden because of the flooding. Found this Holiday Innon a beautiful quiet street in Spandau (northwest suburb). The staffwere extremely helpful, spokeexcellent English, and tolerated my German. They helped us witheverything fromfinding a self-service laundromat to calling the Deutsch Auto Club toget us a flood-free route back to Prague for our flight home. Our roomwas definitely at the top end of the Holiday Inn scale. Breakfastbuffets (included) were bountiful; one could choose amomg American style(bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, etc.) or German style (boiled eggs,rolls, jams, cheeses, cold cuts, etc.). Their indoor-outdoor Trattoriaserved very good dishes just right for late night suppers.The hotel iswithin three easy walking blocks through a very quiet, safe neighborhoodto the Rohrdamm U-bahn (subway) station, from which there is easy accesstoall parts of Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Berlin City-West
HotelInfo.Address: Rohrdamm 80, 13629 Berlin, Germany (Formerly HI Berlin Esplanade)
